summary: Email correspondence from First Bank's legal requirements department to an AUSA regarding a federal grand jury subpoena for Jeffrey Epstein case #19353, indicating the bank is working on producing account records as requested.

persons.name: Veronica Martinez
persons.context: Recipient of the email regarding the Jeffrey Epstein federal grand jury subpoena case.

persons.name: Lawrence Odell
persons.context: Recipient of the email regarding the Jeffrey Epstein federal grand jury subpoena case.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The individual whose financial records are being subpoenaed by a federal grand jury, referenced in the case number and subject line.

connections.description: Martinez, as part of the bank's legal team, is involved in responding to a subpoena for Epstein's financial records.
Odell, as part of the bank's legal team, is involved in responding to a subpoena for Epstein's financial records.

events.title: Bank Response to Epstein Grand Jury Subpoena
events.description: First Bank's legal department sends an email to an AUSA confirming receipt of a federal grand jury subpoena for Jeffrey Epstein's accounts and indicating they are working on producing the requested records.

keyFacts: A federal grand jury subpoena was issued for Jeffrey Epstein's financial records at First Bank under case number #19353.
First Bank's legal requirements department was actively working on producing the requested account information as of March 10, 2020.
The communication highlights the ongoing financial investigation into Epstein even after his death, as the subpoena was active in 2020.
